metadata.title: CVE-2021-23210 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A floating point exception (divide-by-zero) issue was discovered in SoX infuncton read_samples() of voc.c file. An attacker with a crafted file,could cause an application to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23210` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox2 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
sox - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2').
